newsitem.title: UK: FTSE 100 opens weaker, hurt by big Dow fall.
newsitem.headline: FTSE 100 opens weaker, hurt by big Dow fall.

text.p: The FTSE 100 opened weaker on Wednesday, retreating from near all-time highs, dented by large losses for U.S. shares late on Tuesday, dealers said.

The leading British index fell 25.2 points to 5,050.6 by 0735 GMT. It gained 43.9 points by Tuesday's close with the Dow trading up eight points. The U.S. index ended the New York session 101.27 points down at 7,960.84.
Dealers said the market was proving resilient in the face of large movements on the Dow.
"The market is not immune but it is used to these big swings on Wall Street," said Charterhouse group economist Richard Jeffrey.
